COMMON.DESCRIPTION:
Welcome to the self assessment Building Energy Efficiency Calculator (BEEC). This tool was created under the framework of the Euroclima+ program by the Copenhagen Centre of Energy Efficiency (C2E2), an Energy Efficiency hub institutionally part of the UNEP DTU Partnership.

The Energy Sustainable Municipal Buildings project is funded by Euroclima +, the flagship cooperation program of the European Union for environmental sustainability and climate change in Latin America. In Argentina, the French Development Agency (AFD) is in charge of the implementation. The National University of La Plata (UNLP) is the entity responsible and leader of the project for its execution. The Red Argentina de Municipios frente al Cambio Clim√°tico (RAMCC) and the Copenhagen Center for Energy Efficiency (C2E2) are the strategic partners for the realization of the project.

About BEEC
This self assessment Building Energy Efficiency Calculator (BEEC) is designed to provide individual users a preliminary rapid assessment platform where they can assess their building energy performance. The overall objective of BEEC is three fold:
a. Support the development of a rapid assessment of the energy performance of individual buildings;
b. Create a comparative evaluation between the baseline energy performance with energy efficiency (EE) standards.
c. Share recommendations of potential EE measures across building components and systems.
The tool is intended to cater to the needs of municipalities and relevant stakeholders. The tool may be used for overall understanding of impact on overall building energy consumption profile with respect to various system and component level parameters. The target users may be energy managers, analysts, maintenance and operation professionals, technicians and any individual with basic know-how on buildings and energy efficiency.
COMMON.DISCLAIMER-TEXT: The objective of the tool is to provide an indicative and holistic outcome on the building energy efficiency based on the user's input data. The tool does not replace the simulations and assessments from a full fledged tools and licensed software available in the market. The output results hence is recommended to be used for reference purpose only and may not be used for detailed or investment grade design and implementation activities.The tool is built based on technical literature data, available global and local standards, tool developers' knowledge and experience in the sector. Care has been taken to deliver the most possibly suitable platform. However, due to the challenges in availability of country specific data with respect to climate files, building envelope standards, equipment and appliances, energy efficiency applications, operations, technology and related resources, etc. we understand that there may be certain differences with other similar available online and licensed tools. All the assumptions have been listed in the Assumptions page.The information shared in this form will be used to asses the building performance and potential savings through energy efficient measures.
COMMON.FIELDVALUE_KNOWN_TEXT: Enter the value in the cell and select the units from the drop down list.
COMMON.NOTKNOWN_OPTION_DEFAULT: No, I don't know. (default values will be assumed for calculations)

GENDETAILS.LOC_DETAILS_NOTE_TEXT: Select Province first and then Location.If exact location is not available, please select the nearest / most suitable location (or) reach out to us.
GENDETAILS.BUILDING_DETAILS_TEXT: Please select building type and its areas.
GENDETAILS.BUILDING_DETAILS_NOTE_TEXT: Please first select the building type and applicable building spaces from drop down list.If your building type is not available in the list, please select the most representative building type.
GENDETAILS.BUILDING_FUN_DETAILS_NOTE_TEXT: Please enter details on number of floors, occupancy hours and built up area. You may select units in which you may want to enter for the building area value using the drop down button.
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_TEXT: Please share occupancy details for the building.
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_NOTE_TEXT: Select from following options. For option C, standard values will be considered based on the building categories and spaces selected. More details on this is given in the Assumptions section.
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_PEOPLEOCCUPYING: I only know the number of people occupying the building during normal working hours.
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_PEOPLEOCCUPYING_TEXT: Number of people occupying the building
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_PEOPLEOCCUPYING_HINT: Example for number of people input
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_OCCDENSITY: I know the occupant density of the building.
GENDETAILS.OCCUPANCY_OCCDENSITY_TEXT: You may choose to enter the values for any of the units mentioned below. Necessary units conversions will be made by the tool for respective calculations.
GENDETAILS.ENERGYANDFUEL_TEXT: Please enter energy and fuel details associated with the building.
GENDETAILS.ENERGYANDFUEL_NOTE_TEXT: Fuel considered as natural Gas. If any other forms of fuel is being used, please reach out to us. Select the units from the drop down list.

BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RVALUE_QUESTION: Do you know the R value?
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.ROUTERWALL_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide details on R value of the wall.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RVALUE_IMAGES: I want to select from predefined types (pictures available for reference)
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.ROUTERWALL_IMAGES_TEXT: Select most representative picture composition of your building outer wall.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RVALUE_CUSTOMLAYERS: Calculate the R value by adding custom layers from prelisted materials(Advanced level)
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RVALUE_CUSTOMLAYERS_STEP1: Select the layer number from the dropdown list.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RVALUE_CUSTOMLAYERS_STEP2: Select material type from dropdown list and proceed with the tool.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RVALUE_CUSTOMLAYERS_STEP3: Return to insert the custom R value.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RROOF_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide details on R value of the roof.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RROOF_IMAGES_TEXT: Select most representative picture composition of your building roof.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RWINDOW_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide details on R value of the window.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RWINDOW_PREDEFINED_OPTION: I want to select from predefined types (list available)
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.RWINDOW_PREDEFINED_DIALOG_TEXT: Select R Value from predefined types
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.SHGC_QUESTION: Do you know the SHGC value?
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.SHGC_KNOWN_TEXT: Do you know the SHGC value?
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.SHGC_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide details on SHGC value of the window.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.WWR_QUESTION: Do you know the Window to Wall Ratio?
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.WWR_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide details on WWR value of the window.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.WWR_NOTKNOWN: No, I don't know. Guide me to enter the value.
BUILDINGENV_DETAILS.WWR_NOTKNOWN_TEXT: Please enter the WWR value in(%) by refering to pictures

LIGHTING.LIGHTING_TITLE: Lighting fixture details(Stock and Technology type of lighting fixtures)
LIGHTING.LIGHTING_NOTE_TEXT: Please be ready with type, number, power rating (wattage) details of the lighting fixtures

HVAC.HEATING_EFFICIENCY_QUESTION: Do you know the heating equipment efficiency of your building?
HVAC.HEATING_EFFICIENCY_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options. You may find these values on the equipment name plate or design document or from supplier.

HVAC.HEATING_EFFICIENCY_NOHEATING_EQUIP: The building does not use any heating equipment
HVAC.HEATING_EFFICIENCY_KNOWN_TEXT: The value should be available on the equipment name plate or contact the supplier.For Heat pumps enter COP value.
HVAC.HEATING_EFFICIENCY_IMAGES_TEXT: Please select the most representative picture for your heating equipment type.
HVAC.COOLING_EFFICIENCY_QUESTION: Do you know the cooling equipment performance parameters of your building?
HVAC.COOLING_EFFICIENCY_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options. You may find these values on the equipment name plate or design document or from supplier. Please enter the value in below text box and select respective units.
HVAC.COOLING_EFFICIENCY_NOCOOLING_EQUIP: The building does not use any cooling equipment
HVAC.COOLING_EFFICIENCY_KNOWN_TEXT: I have the efficiency/performance parameter for the air conditioning equipment of my building.

HVAC.VENTILATION_QUESTION: Do you know the ventilation rate value for your building?
HVAC.VENTILATION_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide building infiltration rate.
HVAC.VENTILATION_KNOWN_TEXT: You may choose to enter the values for any of the units mentioned below. Necessary units conversions will be made by the tool for respective calculations.
HVAC.VENTILATION_KNOWN_UNITS_CUBICMETERPERMIN: cubic meter per minute per person
HVAC.VENTILATION_KNOWN_UNITS_CUBICFEETPERMINP: cubic feet per minute per person
HVAC.INFILTRATION_QUESTION: Do you know the infiltration rate value for your building?
HVAC.INFILTRATION_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide building infiltration rate.

HVAC.ECONOMIZER_QUESTION: Do you have and actively manage the economizer / free cooling to cater to your cooling needs?
HVAC.ECONOMIZER_NOTE_TEXT: Economizer is a part of the outdoor system of an HVAC system. It can be used to avail optimal free cooling using outside air if the outside ambient conditions are favourable with respect to the temperatures and humidity levels. N/A: Not applicable
HVAC.MISCELLANEOUSDATA_NOTE_TEXT: Average indoor air temperature being maintained throughout the year inside the building. It can also be the temperature set points at the user side (occupant areas). Enter the value in either units i.e. degree Centigrade (¬∫C) or degree Fahrenheit (¬∫F) N/A: Not applicable
HVAC.COMPRESSORS_QUESTION: Inverter / VFD / Speed controller for HVAC compressors installed?
HVAC.FANSANDBLOWERS_QUESTION: Inverter / VFD / Speed controller for HVAC fans and blowers installed?

PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_TITLE: Plug loads (equipment/appliances inside occupied conditioned area)
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_QUESTION: Do you know the plug load density for your building ?
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options. Option C available for selected cases only.
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_GUIDE_OPTION: No, I don't know. Guide me to calculate.
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_GUIDE_OPTION_TEXT: Plug load refer to energy used by equipment that is plugged into an outlet. For example, in an office, key plug loads include computer and monitors, printers, and copiers. Equipment/Appliances include other connected load such as the prefilled examples in the table. Do not include major lighting fixture details that have already been entered in the lighting section. Table lamps, plugged task lightings, etc. which were not covered in the lighting section may be entered here. Do not include large HVAC system components here.
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOAD_GUIDE_TABLE_AVGOPERATINGHRS: Average operating hours per day(if available)
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_EXISTING_OPTION: I will select from already available values.
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOADS_EXISTING_OPTION_TEXT: Options available for selected cases only. Select the most suitable type and closest area to your building. If the values in the options are far from your building values, please opt for Option B.
PLUGLOADS.PLUGLOAD_OPSANDPRATICES_TEXT: Select the option Yes or No and enter the quantity

CO2EMISSIONS.POWERGENCO2EMISSIONS_QUESTION: Do you know the local grid emission factor ?
CO2EMISSIONS.POWERGENCO2EMISSIONS_NOTE_TEXT: Applicable for electricity import from the grid.
CO2EMISSIONS.ONSITECO2EMISSIONS_QUESTION: Do you know the fuel CO2 emission factor?
CO2EMISSIONS.ONSITECO2EMISSIONS_NOTE_TEXT: You may select any of the options to provide details of On-site CO2 emissions (especially if you are using fuel based heating equipment or power generators, etc.).Natural Gas equivalent CO2 emissions values will be used for the assessment.
CO2EMISSIONS.ONSITECO2EMISSIONS_KNOWN_TEXT: Please enter value and choose any one from the available units

INPUTSUMMARY.INPUTSUMMARY_TEXTB: The user has selected from available options.
INPUTSUMMARY.INPUTSUMMARY_TEXTC: Are default values by the tool resulting from the user's selection of available options.
INPUTSUMMARY.INPUTSUMMARY_ASSUMPTIONS:
• Locations with hourly climate data available are only considered in the tool for now.
  • If the ‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt know‚Äù option is selected, appropriate average/efficiency/benchmark values are loaded to the tool based on location, building type and preceding answers in the tool. These values are adopted as applicable from several published and widely referred sources such as Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation ‚Äì Argentina, University of La Plata ‚Äì Argentina, ASHRAE standards, U.S. Energy Information Administration, U.S. Department of Energy, Energy Star ratings ‚Äì U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Ntional Renewable Energy Laboratory (U.S.DoE), Country Savings assessments ‚Äì United for Efficiency UNEP, Bureau of Energy Efficiency ‚Äì India, design details from equipment / appliance manufacturers and suppliers, years of energy auditing experience, etc.
  • Building is assumed to be a 12 ft height, floor-to-floor, square footprint.
  • Weather data for the places provided in the tool are taken from http://climate.onebuilding.org/WMO_Region_3_South_America/ARG_Argentina/index.html * For the heat load calculations, envelope convective heat transfer, envelope solar gain (except for windows), are not considered.
  • The building is treated as a single thermal zone.
  • Occupied hours first fill weekdays symmetrically around noon, and then fill weekends.
  • Infiltration is assumed zero during occupied times (pressurization).
  • Airside economizer operates only when full cooling load can be met - no partial economizer with mechanical cooling.
  • Lights and plug loads are assumed to be at 1/20 power density during unoccupied times.
  • There is no energy consumption calculated for hot water heating. There is no energy calculated for hot water hydronic pumping.
  • Air system is in variable volume setting by default unless the user chooses "No" option.
  • Window area is equally distributed on N,S,E,W exposures. Window to Wall ratio does ratio default inputs does not consider impact on lighting energy.
  • Window solar - Normal radiation is based on hourly solar angles.
  • Indoor air relative humidity maintained at 50%. The temperature is user defined.
  • Only average most common efficient values considered for comparison. However, relatively highest and better efficiency values are available in the market. Please reach out to us, if you come across such efficient values. We will review and integrate the same into the tool.
  • At times, average most efficient values are considered for calculation when the user selects "I don't know" option.
  • Max occupant density value among the standard values for selected building category / spaces is considered for calculations when the user selects "I don't know" option.
  • R value (Thermal resistance) - Roof: For R values of roofs, standards for both winter (inv) and summer (ver) are available. However the higher U values i.e. for summer are being considered for calculations when the user selects Option B or Option C for this.
  • Plug loads: Standard average efficiencies are considered for calculations if the user selects Option B i.e. "I don't know". Also, for electrical radiators, only equipment efficiency is considered as 100% since entire electricity input is converted to heat energy. However its real usage energy efficiency may be lower if other grid losses are considered.
  • Operating hours of appliances/equipment assumed to be at least 50% of daily occupancy hours in case the user does not mention the actual operating hours in Plug Loads Option B inventory and operating data entry.
  • For standardization and user guidance, Energy Performance Index (EPI) is calculated based on total built up area which is considered as carpet area + thickness of outer walls + balcony - parking area. However the cell does not prevent the user from entering any other forms of area for calculation.
